basics.name: Rafael Bezerra da Escóssia
basics.label: Data Specialist
basics.summary: I have a passion for the field of analytics, with deep knowledge of data science and a love for statistics and mathematics. I have participated in projects involving the development and maintenance of large-scale data infrastructures at a global level. I hold certifications in various cloud platforms, including Google Cloud and AWS, as well as professional certifications as a Data Engineer and Data Scientist from IBM.

work.name: IBM - São Paulo, Brazil
work.summary: Responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining systems and processes that ingest raw data and generate high-quality, consistent information to support downstream use cases. This includes managing end-to-end ETL processes while ensuring security, reliability, availability, elasticity, and scalability, all while optimizing costs.
highlights: Worked with some of the largest telecommunications companies in Brazil as part of a team that led a large-scale data migration between companies.
Developed and managed a unified data environment that eliminated silos and became the single source of truth for people analytics within the company.
Tools and Technologies: Shell Script, SQL, Ferramentas de ETL (IBM DataStage, Informatica Powercenter), Python, Scala, Apache Spark, Apache Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, Git, GitHub and others.

work.name: Engetec - Natal, Brazil
work.summary: Consultant responsible for investigating and analyzing energy consumption in Brazilian cities, determining the revenue generated from taxes and the funds allocated for expenditures, enabling better financial balance.
highlights: Audited energy consumption for cities in Brazil, providing technical engineering support and skilled programming knowledge that led, on average, an economy of 15% for clients.
Tools and Technologies: Python, Pandas, SQL, and Shell Script.

work.name: MAN Truck and Bus - Munich, Germany
work.summary: Intern Mechanical Engineer responsible for overseeing the logistics and operations of bodywork components, managing the entire process from manufacturing to production and final delivery, ensuring efficiency and quality throughout the supply chain and manufacturing process.
highlights: Developed internal processes using VBA and Excel to simplify technology exchange among Volkswagen group companies, shorting wait time by 3 months
Prepared plans for mechanical verification, product development, and factory processes.
Coordinated Volkswagen group presentations in expositions meetings.

volunteer.summary: Worked on the development of the first Brazilian self-adjusting rocket as part of the electronic team. COBRUF organizes events, festivals, and rocket-building competitions to promote the aerospace industry.
highlights: Contributed to the design and construction of an innovative self-adjusting rocket.
Collaborated with multidisciplinary teams to integrate electronics into the rocket system.

courses: Course Syllabus: Exploratory Data Analysis, Database and Visualization, Statistical Inference, Predictive Analysis, Time Series Analysis, Spatial Statistics, Informational Modeling, Matrix Methods and Cluster Analysis, Market Decisions and Applications, Social Media Analysis and Text Mining, Distributed Databases, Advanced Statistical Modeling, Advanced Predictive Analysis, Business Decisions and Logic Thinking.

education.institution: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte (UFRN), Natal, Brazil
courses: Course Syllabus: Foundations in Statics and Dynamics, Mechanical Vibrations, Thermodynamics, Fluid Dynamics, Stress Analysis, Mechanical Design, Technical Drawing, Industrial Maintenance, CAD/CAE, Programming and Algorithms, Finite Element Methods.
Dissertation: Topology Optimization Method Integrated to Product Development Process.
Completed course among top 1% students with best academic performance index.
Completed one-year study abroad with Westsächsische Hochschule Zwickau (Germany).
Overall champion in international competition (COBRUF 2018) for rocket constructors.
Partnership at a German university, as part of the Mechanical Engineering course at the 'Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte', Brazil.
